quest.name: Against the Dying of the Light
journal: Lucia would begin the hunt for the arsonists without delay.

In order to cover more ground, you and your comrades will divide into two parties and investigate the fires separately. Alphinaud, Y'shtola, and Tataru will focus their efforts on Foundation and the Brume, while you, Thancred, and Hilda will begin by questioning the residents of the Pillars─starting with one Lord Emmanellain de Fortemps, who is a notorious gossip.

Alas, Lord Emmanellain has little to offer beyond charming repartee, and the observation that the Hoplon has been inundated with refugees on their way to receive food and shelter in the Vault─an initiative of Ser Aymeric's, apparently. No closer to identifying the arsonists, Thancred and Hilda resolve to inspect the locations where the fires were set while you question the refugees on the off chance that one knows something of value.

Yet again, your efforts avail you little, for while one child thinks she may have caught a glimpse of a suspicious man, she cannot describe him in any detail. Rendezvous with Thancred and Hilda and share your findings, if such they may be called.

Although Thancred has nothing conclusive to add, he does observe that the fires set near Saint Reymanaud's Cathedral and the Tribunal suffered surprisingly minor damage when compared to other less venerated structures. Mayhap Alphinaud's party can contribute more to the investigation.

It would seem that the efforts of your comrades in Foundation have been rather more fruitful, as they have detained a suspect seen loitering near several homes before they were set alight, and more recently near their smoldering remains. Unconvinced by his protestations of innocence, Thancred tricks the man into confessing by claiming his highborn master betrayed his trust. Return to the Congregation of Our Knights Most Heavenly and share your findings with Lucia.

Having returned to the Congregation, you breathlessly share the findings of your investigation. Though the arsonist withdrew his cooperation scant moments after providing it, Lucia is confident that she will soon have answers. Your conversation is then interrupted by Lord Artoirel, who has come on his father's behalf to deliver a special salve for Ser Aymeric. As Alphinaud watches him leave, he observes that the young nobleman is not in the best of spirits. To this, Lucia responds that given the rumors circulating about his father and the untimely passing of his half-brother, it would be strange if he were otherwise. Truly, none can deny that House Fortemps has known much tragedy of late...
objectives: Speak with Emmanellain at the Jeweled Crozier.
Question the Ishgardians in the Hoplon.
Rendezvous with Alphinaud in the Brume.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The archbishop may have fallen, but the legacy of his predecessors endures.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Just as Ser Aymeric risked his life to bring about lasting change, so too will others wager all to preserve what they hold dear.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Louisoix once told me that man is all too willing to let his future be bound by his past. And time after time have I witnessed how depressingly right he was.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Even if we had the same resources to combat the fires as them up in the Pillars, we'd still be fightin' a losin' battle. You've seen the Brume─all them narrow streets with wooden houses crammed together. It's kindlin' is what it is.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: The flames are spreading. We must needs begin our investigation immediately.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Witnesses must be found; suspects must be identified.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Have you been able to determine the precise locations where the fires were set? Mayhap there is a pattern.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: If there is, we have yet to discern it. Fires have been reported throughout the city, in both the Pillars and Foundation.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Indeed, given the size of the area affected, I think it best to divide our forces. Master Alphinaud and Mistress Y'shtola─I would have you take charge of the investigation in Foundation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As you wish. Mayhap Tataru can be of assistance as well.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Meanin' Forename and me get the Pillars. Oh, they'll like me up there. Only question is, will the grizzled old rogue strikin' a pose over there be joinin' us?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Thancred, of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn. And may I say what a pleasure it is to meet you too, my lady.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: I'll bet. The name's Hilda. A Scion, eh? And there I was thinkin' I'd found a fellow ruffian amongst all these illustrious personages.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: I will remain here to coordinate the fire-quenching effort. If you learn aught of value, pray inform me immediately. That is all.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While we could begin by sifting through charred rubble and questioning random passersby, in my experience, every town has at least one individual who can be counted on to know things he or she should not.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Oh, aye...the infamous Lord Emmanellain de Fortemps, lover of women and wine─though neither care for him that much. They say he could gossip for Ishgard.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Just the sort of fellow I had in mind. Capital suggestion, Forename.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: He'll be at the Crozier most like, makin' an effort to be seen. So let's go and see him.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...Grizzled I will accept, but old? <sigh>

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Someone once said that a gentleman is rather than does. And in Lord Emmanellain I sense we have living proof.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Well, go on then. Talk to the daft sod.

dialogue.name: HONOROIT
dialogue.text: (Ah, MistressMaster Surname. I fear Lord Emmanellain has once more strayed from the path.)

dialogue.name: HONOROIT
dialogue.text: (As has so often been the case, his renewed enthusiasm for martial training gave way to frustration and disinterest at the first sign of difficulty...)

dialogue.name: BEAUTY02162
dialogue.text: I cannot well abandon my parents! But milord will not accept all three of us into his service. What am I to do?

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: What did we do to deserve this?

dialogue.name: ISHGARDIANPRIEST02162
dialogue.text: Have faith, my brothers and sisters, have faith! Halone has not forsaken you! We have not forsaken you!

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: I have faith that Ser Aymeric will soon return to assume command. And when he does, I would welcome him with a gift─our arsonists, bound and begging for mercy.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Prior to the fire, do you perchance recall anyone unfamiliar loitering in the vicinity?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Wooden dwellings built end-to-end and one atop another, each home to a family... How many were abed when the fires were set...?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You didn't expect me to stand idly by when there was work to be done, did you?

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: Well, well, if it isn't Forename, dearest of all my friends! You're looking rather glum. Something the matter, old girlboy?

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, the arsons. Dreadful business, that─and awfully curious, wouldn't you say? There doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to it at all. Naturally, we've doubled the guard outside the manor, along with most of the other houses. Can't have the old pile going up in flames, after all!

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: Oh, in case you were wondering why the Hoplon is awash with refugees, the lower levels of the Vault have been opened to those unfortunate souls who have lost their homes. Ser Aymeric's orders, from what I hear. Remarkable man─not even a knife in the ribs can keep him from his duties!

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: Actually, old girlboy...if you were thinking of questioning the refugees, I should be more than happy to accompany you to the Hoplon. While you conduct your inquiries, I could offer words of comfort to the distressed and despondent young maidens...?

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: Wait a moment...I know what that is. You're giving me one of your looks, aren't you? You do me an injustice, old girlboy! I will have you know, my heart yearns for but one rose─prickly though she may be!

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: ...I sense you remain unconvinced. Very well, if it will help to prove the purity of my intentions, I shall gracefully rescind my offer. Now run along and catch those arsonists!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That was...not entirely what I had hoped for. Whose idea was it to come here again?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Never mind. For our next step, I suggest we divide our efforts. While you question the refugees in the Hoplon, Forename, I shall investigate the locations where the fires were set. Would you be so good as to join me, Hilda?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: You know what, I reckon I would. Can't have you roamin' about in an unfamiliar city by your lonesome, can we? You'd only get robbed blind and left shiverin' in your smallclothes.

dialogue.name: EMMANELLAIN
dialogue.text: I shall detain you no longer, old girlboy. Good luck with your investigation!

dialogue.name: HONOROIT
dialogue.text: My lord is a gentleman of unassailable principles. To assail them, after all, one would first need to locate them.

dialogue.name: BEAUTY02162
dialogue.text: Ours was one of the first homes to be claimed, but I didn't see how the fire began.

dialogue.name: BEAUTY02162
dialogue.text: It was only when I heard our neighbors shouting that I looked outside and saw the flames. We barely escaped with the clothes on our backs. Were it not for the church's generosity, I don't know what we'd do.

dialogue.name: BEAUTY02162
dialogue.text: Say what you will about the archbishop, but I'll not hear a word spoken against the clergy.

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: There was a man with a satchel. I saw him kneelin' outside the window, and then there was smoke everywhere, and it was so hot, and I couldn't breathe...

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: I don't remember how I made it out. I s'pose I must have climbed... Maybe my arm is gettin' better after all?

dialogue.name: MAELIE
dialogue.text: Why did he do it? What did we ever do to him?

dialogue.name: ISHGARDIANPRIEST02162
dialogue.text: Come, my brothers and sisters! There is food and shelter enough for all in the basilica!

dialogue.name: REFUGEE02162
dialogue.text: Halone's blessings be upon you, Father.

dialogue.name: REFUGEE02162
dialogue.text: I confess, we were not sure if we should come. There are so many unbelievable tales these days─about the archbishop, and Ser Aymeric, and the Dravanians...

dialogue.name: ISHGARDIANPRIEST02162
dialogue.text: Trust in your heart, brother, and pay no heed to the lies of lesser men. They seek only to lead you astray.

dialogue.name: ISHGARDIANPRIEST02162
dialogue.text: Do you require succor as well, misssir?

dialogue.name: ISHGARDIANPRIEST02162
dialogue.text: So the Temple Knights have begun their investigation at last! Good. This madness has gone on far too long.

dialogue.name: ISHGARDIANPRIEST02162
dialogue.text: Would that I could do something to aid you in your search, but I have a duty to these poor souls. Farewell, and may the Fury guide your steps.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Finished, then?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are. Anything to share?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hmph. We will require more than the muddled testimony of a traumatized girl if we are to identify the culprits...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While you were questioning the refugees, we inspected the scenes of several of the fires, including one near Saint Reymanaud's Cathedral and another near the Tribunal. For a mercy, neither structure suffered significant damage.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Some might say they were spared by the grace of the Fury. Others might question how such ruthlessly efficient arsonists contrived to fail so miserably on the two occasions when their target was a bastion of Ishgardian orthodoxy.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Nothing conclusive, of course, but it does give one cause to wonder. Alphinaud will doubtless have an opinion.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Good. Now that you are here, we can proceed with the interrogation.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: You should've seen the way Alphinaud tackled him!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Silence will avail you naught, sir.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! I was just about to summon you. As you can see, we have detained a suspect.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We found this man loitering near the remains of one of the stricken buildings. According to eyewitnesses, he was also present before the fires broke out.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We wished to have words; he did not. So we insisted.

dialogue.name: PYROMANIAC02162
dialogue.text: Let me go, damn it! You've got the wrong man!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> My, but you reek of oil. And are those burns on your hands? An occupational hazard, I suppose. But tell me─does arson pay well?

dialogue.name: PYROMANIAC02162
dialogue.text: I-I'm a victim, you imbecile! Look at me!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Aye, that you are─after a fashion. You should know that your pious patron has already spun us a delightful yarn about how his pet mongrel slipped the leash and set about burning half the city to the ground. Not very noble of him, I grant you─but then these highborn types rarely do show loyalty to their pets.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...In fact, he called you rabid and begged us to put you down.

dialogue.name: PYROMANIAC02162
dialogue.text: Th-That's bollocks! He's the one what told me to keep goin'!

dialogue.name: PYROMANIAC02162
dialogue.text: ...Even a sinner such as me could find salvation in the Fury's work, he said. I'd left it behind─tried to, with all my heart! Said my prayers every day, like a good man. But he came to me! He came to me!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And there you have it. Hilda, would you be so kind as to escort our friend here to the Congregation?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Aye. So long as you don't mind if he's limpin' when he gets there.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: That was incredible, Thancred! But how did you know he would confess?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Well, I have seen his like before. A troubled soul, manipulated by men of power and wielded as a weapon...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I could not be certain, of course. But given the stakes, I thought it worth the risk.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And if our captive had called your bluff?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Must we entertain hypotheticals? The world as it is is vexing enough.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, Thancred. Whether by luck or judgment, we have at last confirmed that these arsons were orchestrated by a person or persons of influence. I think it best that we now return to the Congregation and discuss how best to proceed.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Thank the Twelve you've returned to us! But what happened to your old outfit?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, about that...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Temple Knights are interrogating the arsonist as we speak. Gods willing, we shall have more information ere long.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If we could but determine the motive behind these fires...

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Bit of a gambler, ain't he? Fine by me, so long as his luck don't run out.

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: Apologies, Forename, but the interrogation is ongoing.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: On behalf of the Holy See of Ishgard, I thank you all.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: The man you apprehended is being interrogated as we speak. Though he fell silent upon realizing that we had not turned his master, he will soon tell us what he knows, one way or another.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: Pardon the intrusion, First Commander...

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Ah, Lord Artoirel. Are you come to see your father? He is attending Ser Aymeric in his chambers at present.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: I am. He bid me bring this salve.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Then do not let me detain you. And thank you for your kindness, my lord.

dialogue.name: ARTOIREL
dialogue.text: In times of trouble, every man must do his part. Would that I could do more.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...My lord Artoirel did not seem to be in the best of spirits.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: 'Tis little wonder, Master Alphinaud. His father is widely slandered, and his half-brother not yet cold in the grave.

obj.n: As Goes Light, So Goes Darkness
